NAME.Nominative: Venerable Marcellus, Abbot of the Monastery called the “Unsleeping Ones” († 485)

LIFE.Copyright: Bulgakov Handbook. Copyright 1999-2008 Archpriest Eugene D. Tarris.

SAINT.LIFE: Born in Apamea, Syria, he first practiced asceticism in Ephesus, but then transferred to the Monastery of the Sleepless Ones in Constantinople (Refer to Feb. 23) where for his virtuous life he was also chosen to be the rector. He died about the year 486.

LITURGY.TROPARION: In thee, O father, that which was created according to the image of God was manifestly saved. * For accepting thy cross thou didst follow after Christ, * and praying thou didst learn to disdain the flesh, * for thou didst transcend it to take care of thine immortal soul. ** Wherefore, with the angels doth thy soul rejoice, O venerable Marcellus.
